column4: Hi ! I have a question about installing an app manualy, Could you help me ?
I just installed hubiC-browser (something like dropbox|ubuntu one) in /opt. I would like to be able to call it in the term so i putted a symLink in /usr/local/bin
problem is: when I call it I got this error: /usr/local/bin/hubiC-browser: 18: /usr/local/bin/hubiC-browser: /usr/local/bin//opt/ovh/hubiC-browser/.hubiC-browser-bin: not found
why i try to go to /usr/local/bin//opt/... ?
*it
because you called kn the wrong way.
You did it wrong :)
hunhun... I tried it before and just tried it again but still don't work... :S
whats the full path to your original file?
sudo ln -s /opt/ovh/hubiC-browser/hubiC-browser /usr/local/bin/hubiC-browser
And where is /usr/local/bin/hubiC-browser now pointing to? Check it with ls -lha /usr/local/bin/hubiC-browser
seems to be good...
And /opt/ovh/hubiC-browser/hubiC-browser is executable? Check it with ls -lha too
And how exactly are you trying to invoke that binary then?
problem is: it seems it find the exec file but this file call an other wich is in /opt/..... but he try to find it in the wrong place
And how exactly are you trying to invoke that binary then?
using the terminal
And then staring at it? :D Which command exactly are you running?
then forget about the symlink, and use an alias instead.
cause it's a shity script ?
Exactly.
Ok thanks ! it's what I thooght...
You have to know it :)
